comments:
The following exception occurs on my RCP application.
It does occur whenever "the application gets something to do". Sorry I
didn't find the real reason for the exception. It does however not occur when 
the application is just started and then stopped without doing anything.
The application consists of several plugins.

It seems you have a copy of Xerces in one of your plug-ins
(com.agynamix.guardian.workbench.core) and it is being exported to other
plug-ins (see bug 87835 were this happens as well).

At the time the org.eclipse.ui.workbench plug-in shuts down,
com.agynamix.guardian.workbench.core has already been stopped. The solution is
to disable auto-activation for the plug-in providing Xerces. Create a new
plug-in, move the Xerces code there, force the creation of a bundle manifest
file (see tab Runtime in the Plug-in manifest editor) and change the activation
rule to not activate the plug-in.

traces.message: The class "com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl" cannot be loaded because the system is shutting down and the plug-in "com.agynamix.guardian.workbench.core" has already been stopped.
